title: Job Vacancies at Arnergy Solar Limited
content:
Arnergy is a distributed utility providing energy reliability to SMEs and economic clusters in emerging market with flexible acquisition options including energy Subscription (ES) based on monthly fixed fee, consumer financed Lease to Own (LO) with monthly instalment or a Outright Sales (OS) option. Arnergy is on track to deploy excess of 100 Megawatt installed PV capacity powering more than 35,000 businesses across impact sectors not limited to Healthcare, Education, Hospitality by 2023. If you are excited to be part of the solution to Africa's energy crisis starting with Nigeria, we are happy to have you on board.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Field Service Lead
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As our Field Service Lead, you will be responsible for the maintenance of customer systems.
	You will lead a team of engineers and technicians responsible for managing solar systems operations,
	driving operational excellence and optimal service delivery


Responsibilities


	Oversee the day-to-day operations and maintenance of solar installations across various states to ensure systems operate efficiently and reliably.
	Provide technical leadership to a team of highly trained and certified engineers and technicians.
	Coordinate and manage a team of field engineers and technicians to conduct routine inspections, preventive maintenance, and corrective repairs on solar PV systems, inverters, and batteries.
	Conduct site visits to resolve customer issues, optimize system performance, and provide hands-on troubleshooting when needed.
	Provide technical expertise in diagnosing and resolving issues related to solar panels, inverters, battery storage systems and other energy systems.
	Implement strategies to optimize system efficiency, reduce operational costs, and extend the lifespan of solar assets.
	Coordinate with the project management team to schedule installations, maintenance, and repairs in a timely and efficient manner.
	Conduct acceptance tests for deployed solar solutions and systems
	Lead issue resolution efforts, showing exceptional leadership and providing superior customer satisfaction.
	Ensure zero instances of service disruptions, being largely accountable for service uptime.


Requirements & Skills
You'll be a good fit for this role if:


	You currently lead an operations or service team in a telco, energy or utility sector. You lead from the front.
	You have hands on experience with ERP usage
	You get things done; you are an execution expert with relevant certifications.
	You have a background in computer/electrical/mechanical engineering or related
	technical discipline, or equivalent experience. You are an engineer at heart and in practice.
	You have deployed, supported or managed products, scaling over 20,000 customers/service nodes.
	You are hard as nails - you don’t take no for an answer. You are also very empathetic, understanding people need time to adapt.
	Customers love you; you are really good with people; you work well with people - you are the life of the party.
	You are proactive, and on point. You are excellence-personified.
	You have hands-on experience with electricity. You can wire a 4-bedroom apartment.
	You are on top of your game, ideally you are a sector thought leader.
	You have sound commercial acumen, with a data driven approach to decision making - experience with P&L is desirable.
	Numbers make you smile, you love them.
	You would rate yourself a minimum of 7 in any of the following tools (MS
	Project/Asana/Basecamp/Jira/Excel)


We’d also like to see:


	Flexibility and comfort working in a fast-paced, changing environment
	An attribute of grit
	Good communication, strong leadership qualities
	Compliance oriented, good interpersonal skills
	Excellent time management, task prioritizing and organizational ability
	High level of attention to detail.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Project Field Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As our Field Service Engineer, you will be responsible for the maintenance of customers’ solar/energy systems.
	You will handle operations and maintenance activities in your cluster ensuring energy availability and customer satisfaction.


Responsibilities


	Handle the day-to-day operations and maintenance of solar installations across your assigned cluster to ensure systems operate efficiently and reliably.
	Handle routine inspections, preventive maintenance, and corrective repairs on solar PV systems, inverters, and batteries.
	Conduct site visits to resolve customer issues, optimize system performance, and provide hands-on troubleshooting when needed.
	Provide technical expertise in diagnosing and resolving issues related to solar panels, inverters, battery storage systems and other energy systems.
	Work with the project management team to handle installations, commissioning, maintenance, and repairs in a timely and efficient manner.
	Handle acceptance tests for deployed solar solutions and systems
	Ensure zero instances of service disruptions, being largely accountable for service uptime in your cluster.
	Ensure excellent customer experience for clients in your cluster.
	Ensure that all operation and maintenance activities performed at client locations  comply with best-in-class standards and practices.
	Perform site assessment and load analysis on prospects' facilities where required.
	Ensure 24/7 availability for emergency callouts


Requirements & Skills
You'll be a good fit for this role if you have:


	Minimum of a B.Eng/B.Sc in Electrical Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in solar systems and electrical wiring. 
	Good technical knowledge, diagnostic and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to learn and work on changing and emerging technologies.
	Ability to build an environment and relationship of trust and credibility with customers, to best promote Arnergy in the local market.
	People-management skills.
	Ability to evaluate and target potential customers.
	Good knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace.
	A driver’s License


We’d also like to see:


	Flexibility and comfort working in a fast-paced, changing environment
	An attribute of grit
	Good communication, strong leadership qualities
	Compliance oriented, good interpersonal skills
	Excellent time management, task prioritizing and organizational ability
	High level of attention to detail.

3.) Field Service Engineer

Job Location: Aba, Abia and Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As our Field Service Engineer, you will be responsible for the maintenance of customers’ solar/energy systems.
	You will handle operations and maintenance activities in your cluster ensuring energy availability and customer satisfaction.

title: Job Vacancies at Prohuman Capital Consulting
content:
Prohuman Capital Consulting is a dynamic HR consulting firm dedicated to empowering organizations with comprehensive human resources expertise and strategic guidance. Founded on the principle that exceptional talent management drives business success, we partner with companies to navigate their most complex HR challenges and unlock their human capital potential. Our reach extends to companies in and around West Africa, where we do business with diverse organizations seeking strategic HR solutions. At Prohuman Capital Consulting, we believe that every organization is unique. Our consultative approach begins with understanding your specific business context, industry dynamics, and organizational culture. We then develop customized solutions that are practical, implementable, and measurable.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Manager - FMCG

Job Location: Lokoja, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are looking for an experienced and target-driven Sales Manager to lead our B2C sales operations in Lokoja, Kogi State.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for driving sales across all SKUs, ensuring accurate delivery, and achieving the set target of 100,000 cases monthly.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive sales growth by raising orders across all product categories.
	Ensure team members achieve their sell-out targets and sell across the full range of products.
	Gather daily market intelligence, including competitor activities.
	Expand customer base through acquisition, retention, and network growth.
	Oversee in-store merchandising and promotional activities.
	Collate and reconcile daily cash collections.
	Monitor stock availability by obtaining daily reports from warehouse managers.
	Lead, motivate, and monitor the sales team for high performance.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 4 - 6 years of work experience.
	Proven experience in FMCG sales management.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data reporting.
	Must be able to drive with a valid driver’s license.
	Willingness to travel across the state for on-the-spot assessments.


Salary
N70,000 - N75,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@emblimited.com.ng or emmanuelbakeriesltdhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We appreciate all applications; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

2.) Bakery Production Supervisor

Job Location: Lokoja, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Bakery Production Supervisor to oversee our daily bakery operations, ensuring high-quality product output, efficient production processes, and adherence to food safety standards.
	The successful candidate will lead our production team and maintain the exceptional standards that Emmanuel Bakeries is known for.


Key Responsibilities


	Production Management: Supervise daily bakery production operations, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality baked goods
	Team Leadership: Lead, train, and manage production staff, including bakers, assistants, and line workers
	Quality Control: Monitor product quality at all stages of production, ensuring consistency and adherence to company standards
	Safety Compliance: Implement and maintain food safety protocols, HACCP standards, and workplace safety regulations
	Inventory Management: Oversee raw material inventory, coordinate with procurement for timely supplies, and minimize waste
	Production Planning: Develop daily and weekly production schedules based on demand forecasts and sales orders
	Equipment Maintenance: Ensure proper maintenance of bakery equipment and coordinate repairs when necessary
	Cost Control: Monitor production costs, identify areas for improvement, and implement cost-saving measures
	Reporting: Prepare daily production reports, track KPIs, and report to senior management
	Training & Development: Train new staff on production procedures, safety protocols, and quality standards


Required Qualifications


	Education: Minimum of OND/HND in Food Science, Food Technology, or related field
	Experience: Minimum 3-5 years of supervisory experience in bakery production or food manufacturing
	Leadership Skills: Proven ability to lead and motivate teams in a fast-paced environment
	Problem-solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
	Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@emblimited.com.ng or emmanuelbakeriesltdhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

3.) Bakery Sales Supervisor

Job Location: Lokoja, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic Bakery Sales Supervisor to lead our sales team and drive revenue growth.
	This role requires a results-oriented individual with strong sales experience and the ability to develop customer relationships while ensuring efficient distribution of our products.


Key Responsibilities


	Sales Management: Lead and manage the sales team to achieve monthly and quarterly sales targets
	Route Planning: Plan and optimize delivery routes to maximize efficiency and customer coverage
	Customer Relations: Build and maintain strong relationships with existing customers (retailers, restaurants, cafes)
	Business Development: Identify and develop new business opportunities and customer accounts
	Market Analysis: Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences
	Team Development: Train, coach, and mentor sales representatives and delivery staff
	Order Management: Oversee order processing, ensure accurate deliveries, and handle customer complaints
	Reporting: Prepare sales reports, track performance metrics, and provide insights to management
	Inventory Coordination: Coordinate with production team to ensure adequate stock levels for sales demand
	Driving Duties: Personally handle key account visits and deliveries when required
	Promotional Activities: Plan and execute promotional campaigns and marketing initiatives
	Credit Management: Monitor customer payments and work with finance team on collections


Required Qualifications


	Education: Minimum of OND/HND in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field
	Experience: Minimum 3-5 years of sales supervisory experience, preferably in FMCG or food industry
	Driving License: Valid Nigerian driver's license with clean driving record (MANDATORY)
	Driving Experience: Minimum 3 years of active driving experience


Sales Skills:


	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets
	Strong negotiation and closing skills
	Customer relationship management experience
	Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate sales teams
	Communication: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
	Technology: Proficiency in MS Office and sales management software


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@emblimited.com.ng or emmanuelbakeriesltdhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Lagoon Hospitals
content:
Lagoon Hospitals has consistently been providing healthcare of international standards in Nigeria. Established in 1984 by Professor Emmanuel and Professor (Mrs.) Oyin Elebute, and commencing operations in 1986 as a provider of integrated healthcare services, Lagoon Hospitals is currently the largest private healthcare services Group in Nigeria with six healthcare facilities.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Medical Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	To provide first point of contact care to patients, clerk all new cases including taking history, examining the patient and making a diagnosis/provisional diagnosis of illnesses and Injuries as soon as possible
	To provide preventative care and acute care, as well as make referrals to specialists as the patients' condition indicates and coordinate the participation of specialists in the patients' treatment
	To carry out procedures under supervision in line with medical privileges
	Maintain complete and accurate documentation of patients’ encounters.
	Prompt incidence reporting and management of patients’ grievances.
	Provide health education and support to patients and their attendants
	Liaise and work with other medical and non-medical staff to ensure quality care is given to patients
	Maintain confidentiality and impartiality
	Comply with the use of Standard Operating Procedures and policies / adherence to quality standards and clinical practice guidelines.


Other duties as assigned:


	Key Result Areas/ Performance Goals:
	Number of missed diagnoses.
	Patients Wait Time
	Patient Follow up
	Use of SOPS / adherence to quality standards and clinical practice guidelines


Educational Qualifications


	MBBS or its equivalent
	Full registration with the Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria, with a valid medical practicing license.
	Valid medical practicing license


Behavioral Competencies:


	Empathetic
	Ethical
	Knowledge- Driven
	Innovative
	Accessible
	Diligent, Responsible, Honest and Reliable
	Good interpersonal and communication skills

Engineering Manager Job at T.O.N Corporate Services




        
    

        
        T.O.N Corporate Services  - Our client provides businesses with a professional phone system that enables teams to manage customer calls efficiently. Their goal is to help businesses improve the quality of their customer interactions while enhancing operational efficiency.

We are recruiting. to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Engineering Manager will oversee all engineering, maintenance, and technical services required for the smooth execution of the Long-Lasting Insecticidal Nets (LLIN) project. This includes managing plant machinery, utilities, preventive maintenance, process optimization, and ensuring compliance with international standards during operations.
	The position involves organizing, managing resources, and communicating with stakeholders (internal and external).


Responsibilities & Accountabilities
Production & Process Engineering:


	Provide technical support for sewing, baling, and packaging operations.
	Oversee setup, installation, and commissioning of new equipment.
	Ensure process efficiency, machine reliability, and minimal downtime.


Maintenance & Utilities:


	Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules for sewing machines, baling presses, forklifts, and related equipment.
	Manage electrical installations, power distribution, backup generators, and HVAC systems.
	Monitor and optimize energy consumption and utility efficiency.


Civil & Facility Works:


	Supervise basic civil works for plant modifications, expansions, or repairs.
	Coordinate with contractors for safe and timely execution of construction/renovation projects.
	Ensure compliance with building safety codes.


Material Handling & Logistics Support:


	Manage operation and maintenance of forklifts and other material handling equipment.
	Train operators and ensure adherence to safety protocols.
	Support layout planning for efficient material flow and storage.


Compliance & Safety:


	Implement and enforce HSE (Health, Safety, Environment) standards.
	Support audits, certifications, and donor/partner inspections.


Leadership & Team Management:


	Lead and mentor engineering, maintenance, and utility teams.
	Plan manpower allocation for round-the-clock operations.
	Foster teamwork, technical upskilling, and a culture of accountability.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering (Master’s is an advantage).
	5+ years of hands-on experience in manufacturing, with at least 2 years in a supervisory/managerial engineering role.
	Proven experience with sewing/textile equipment, utilities (HVAC, electrical), and plant maintenance.
	Strong technical knowledge across multiple engineering disciplines (mechanical, electrical, civil, HVAC).
	Knowledge of forklift operations, civil works, and factory layouts.
	Self-driven and Ability to manage contractors, vendors, and technical service providers.
	Strong background in preventive maintenance, reliability engineering, and project management.
	Strong ability to work independently.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment and prioritize your own workload.
	Ability to build strong internal relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


Skills & Abilities:


	Problem-Solving: Technical problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues effectively.
	Time Management: Ability to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
	Risk Management: Ability to identify, assess, and mitigate technical/safety risks.
	Stakeholder Management: Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and manage their expectations.

Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP) Job at Tulip Cocoa Processing Limited




        
    

        
        Tulip Cocoa Processing Limited processes and exports cocoa products/Beans, operates according to international quality standards, and is certified by SGS.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP)

Job Location: Ikom, Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	The HRBP will collaborate with business leaders to drive organisational performance, ensure compliance and embed a high-performance culture.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	To serve as a strategic guide to regional managers and business leaders to align HR strategies with business objectives.
	Performance management and talent optimisation
	To carry out HR operations and compliance
	Outsource management
	Recruitment, Onboarding and Vendor Management
	Employee engagement and wellbeing
	Planning and reporting.


Requirements


	Qualification: B.Sc / HND in HRM, Business Admin and other related fields
	Experience: 3 - 5 years and above
	Gender: Male and Female
	Age: Not more than 45 years.


Abilities / Requirements:


	Strong knowledge of Nigerian Labour Law and HR best practices
	Proficiency with the HRIS system
	Strong analytical, communication and conflict resolution skills
	Professional HR certification, e.g CIPM, SHRM, HRCI, is a plus.


Salary
N350,000 monthly.
